data.title: Remove obsolete and performance costly RevealsShroud definitions
data.body: from the APC on the dropzone maps. It caused a lot of lag when moving the apc (enable the perf graph, it's quite visible there).

data.title: Wrap OpenRA.exe arguments in quotes
data.body:
On Windows, if the path to the replay contains spaces, it wouldn't be parsed correctly and would crash the game.

Fixes #10572

data.title: Add Support directory to .gitignore file
Split D2k weapons.yaml
data.body:
To make things more organized and in line with other mods.

Split from #10517 to hopefully get this reviewed and merged faster.

Explaining the additions/deletions count:
4 additions for new mod.yaml entries, 1 deletion for weapons.yaml, 3 deletions for one saved empty line per file (now 4 instead of 1), +848/-848 for the weapon entries themselves.

data.title: Refactor naming of Missile's speed-related properties
data.body:
`MaximumSpeed` renamed to just `Speed`.

`MinimumLaunchSpeed` and `MaximumLaunchSpeed` now default to `Speed`.

Note: To solve #10129, additional yaml adjustments might be necessary.

data.title: Give player more control over harvester behavior
data.body:
Personally, I find it rather annoying that players cannot decide themselves whether they want the harvester resource search radius to be limited for safety reasons (like now), or search in a larger radius, possibly whole map at the risk of running into enemies (like AI already does).

A possibility would be to allow players to let harvesters search for further away resources automatically by giving the harvester a 'deploy' command (similar to the Chrono Tank 'deploy').
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/30336217-give-player-more-control-over-harvester-behavior?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: fix nawast popping up on gdi build menu
data.body: Fixes #10631.

data.title: Improve Harvester-related code
data.body:
This removes some duplication and should improve AI performance by reducing frequency of the more expensive AI resource search.

Issues fixed by this PR:
- `Harvester.UnblockRefinery` was not just unblocking, but also performing a resource claim and queueing a `FindResources` activity (which would then perform another resource claim). 
- The `ContinueHarvesting` method would queue another `FindResources` after `UnblockRefinery`, resulting in potentially queueing `FindResources` twice.
- In `FindResources`, if no harvestable position was found, it would perform `harv.UnblockRefinery` and its own unblock at the same tick due to a bogus if check.
- the AI was making the assumption that a `Wait`ing harvester is idle. That is plain wrong, as `Wait` activities are intentionally queued by all harvester-related activities. This resulted in far too many expensive AI resource searches.

data.title: Make UpgradeActorsNear vertical range customizable
data.body:
Includes plumbing to do the same for other ProximityTrigger-based features, but the focus of this PR is UpgradeActorsNear.

Makes it more flexible and a requirement to implement #10590 properly (otherwise aircraft would start reloading while still in the air).

data.title: CreateEffectWarhead: Support for multiple ImpactSound entries
data.body: ImpactSound currently only supports one value. If more are specified it won't play any impact sounds at all.

data.title: Don't grant upgrades to newly built units while disabled
data.body:
before:
https://streamable.com/2rl4
after:
https://streamable.com/ygw5

(you need sound to hear it)

What happened is that UpgradeActorsNear would grant upgrades on newly built actors and revoke it in the next tick when disabled.

data.title: Added Attack*.StopToShoot
data.body: ~~Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2327.~~ See http://modenc.renegadeprojects.com/NoMovingFire for reference.

data.title: Stretchable vertical powerbars
data.body:
I would like to add a vertical powerbar on the D2K, RA2 and TS interfaces.

Here is a branch that partially features this vertical powerbar:
https://github.com/x-a-n-a-x/ra2/tree/RA2_vertical_powerbar

![screenshot001](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/12628099/d0b1a7ec-c541-11e5-95cf-e1ea2c3e1d25.png)

As you can see, the powerbar is misplaced, it's on purpose. I would like it to perfectly work (with the correct graphics and dimensions before placing it over the UI. For the moment I haven't figured how or why the powerbar uses that background.

Note: 
There is no problem if the powerbar has a fixed height (like in ~~TS~~ TD): the powerbar is located next to the radar. But D2K, RA2 and TS need a stretchable vertical powerbar, located next to the Production-palette. 

If the production palette has a fixed number of rows, it could work, but if the player enables the "Build Everything" cheat option in Debug, the production palette then expands and... not the vertical powerbar.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/30271408-stretchable-vertical-powerbars?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Weird attack-move behavior
data.body:
The attack-move command has now a weird behavior.
Is it focusing on buildings or vehicles ?
On this screenshot you can see the behavior of the mammoth tanks when I ordered them to attack-move to my cursor while placing it above the construction yard.
I added the red lines on MS Paint to show the behavior because they are hard to get. I almost spammed "angry" attack-move orders (10+) but the mammoth tanks still wanted to attack the turret instead of the guy.
![weird_attack_move](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/12626933/8b5f5fc8-c53b-11e5-96a9-52c5de8a7fad.png)
I saw way more strange attack-move behaviors, like having a bunch of mammoth tanks attacking a service depot 2 or 3 cells away from them instead of attacking the 15 bazookas right in front of them. Almost 10 attack-move orders sent, target lines straight to the service depot. All the mammoth tanks died, obviously.
They really act like buildings or vehicles are the most important thing to target, or like the first target seen must be destroyed at any cost (this happened with the service depot : they started to attack it and the bazookas finally came close to them but with tons of new attack-move orders they only wanted to attack the service depot)
If you send (fast) attack-move orders while retreating, at one time the closest enemy will be the only one they can see so they will finally attack him.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/30270504-weird-attack-move-behavior?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fix color validator issues and increase color picker palette size.
data.body:
Fixes #10217 by changing the following:
- Default color match threshold decreased from 0x70 to 0x50 (and can now be overridden in mod.yaml).
- Removed matching against all terrain types except clear/water/resources.
- Added additional matching in HSV space so that colors outside the picker range are disallowed.

Also does some code cleanup and increases the size of the color picker to make it more useable.

You can test using 87979d92385d07936d4a1929ff35748d583f33a9 to visualize the blocked colors.

data.title: Improved GPS icons
data.body: Improved GPS icons by enlarging them, adding an outline and changing the pictogram for some of the icons, so it matches the icon tabs in the production panel better. Closes #10504.

data.title: Lua Function Suggestion
data.body:
Hello everyone, I wanna suggest a lua function that GIVES certain prerequisites to a player, example:

-> Until enemy radar is destroyed, the player is not allowed to build airfields.
->> After destroying the radar, the player receives the ability to build airfields.

I'm not sure if this is already implanted, but I couldn't find it anywhere, so I'm really sorry if that was the case.

data.title: Set the correct PlatformTarget for OpenRA.Test
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9114 or at least makes it consistent with other libraries.

data.title: Lua function "Build" gets stuck when it don't have the correct prerequisites for one unit (of a list).
data.body:
I was playing around with .Lua AI for custom missions and I found out that the "Build" function can get the AI stuck while training units if they don't have the necessary prerequisites to train that unit.

Example: AI is trying to train 1tnk, 2tnk and arty (Light Tank, Medium Tank and Artillery respectively), then the player destroys the AI's radar, suddenly the AI stops training Tanks, it won't train Light or Medium tanks either, even though they don't need radar to train, they simply get stuck. I managed to workaround it by performing a constant check if the AI has the prerequisites for each unit it will try to build, but I thought this should be mentioned to the devs. Thanks and sorry if that has been posted before.
## <bountysource-plugin>

data.title: FactionImages does not work with Random faction
data.body: This is only a problem in the map editor if you want to give Multi\* players the actor. It just vanishes in the actors tabs, but appears again when you select Creeps or Neutral which often have a good guy faction set.

data.title: Make FlipX/FlipY flip respective embedded offsets as well
data.body: When a sequence is flipped along an axis, flip embedded offsets for that axis as well.
